result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny R Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kenny R Richardson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kenny R Richardson was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Kenny R Richardson was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary plus statutorily authorized surcharges.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No contact direct or indirect with victims.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 90 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through Petition of Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted.
Perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service for a non-profit agency.

records.addlTxt: Impose 60 days of conditional jail time, to begin upon signing of this orders, or as determined by the Judge.

from Atlanta Ehnert requesting that restraining order be dropped. Per court, apparently no injunction, rather a court-ordered condition of probation. She could go through HELP protocol and maybe have Court-ordered condition modified, but P.O. can keep in effect anyway. Denied.

Defendant Kenny R Richardson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Kenny R Richardson in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that State is dismissing felony charge.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 3. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Count 4 is dismissed. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Kenny R Richardson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Kenny R Richardson in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Reetz requesting rescheduling to 5/18/15, 10:00. Per Court, ok to that date.

No contact direct or indirect with AE. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Kenny R Richardson appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 5/11/15, 10:00.
